text:
Hello, I am trying to recreate a module in a new theme that I’m using.

I cloned the original module and placed it into the relevant folder so that it can be dragged/dropped via the theme’s editor. Then, I copied the `module.html` (HTML + HubL) and the `module.css` files to the recreated module.

The HTML elements are rendering on the page, so I know it’s hooked up properly, but many of the styles are still broken because the original module was relying on a different global stylesheet. Is there a way I can “include” or “import” that stylesheet into the module itself? It’s a fairly complex module, with filters and search, since it’s one that requires the use of a HubDB (hub database).

Thank you. Happy to jump on a call, too, if it’s easier to explain/screenshare.
You can use `{{require_css('path/to/stylesheet')}}` in the html section to include the stylesheet you need. Or you can also add it in the meta.json file.
Yeah, it’s still breaking for me… not sure what else to try
Eeek yea — without seeing the code its difficult to diagnose
Would it be possible to schedule a video call with HubSpot support sometime so that I can screenshare?
You can try — but HS support likely won’t want to help with custom coded solutions. If you post screenshots here / test links and what not, here is usually the place to seek out that kind of help
